content.description: Climb the arching crack from a sit start.
content.location: This is at the top of the talus field in the center of the broken wall of blocks. See the photo.

content.description: Start far left on a left-facing sidepull. Traverse the obvious horizontal on small holds, and top out at the apex.
content.location:
This is on the same boulder and just left of

Pointwork

.

content.description: Start sitting, and mantel onto the low jug ledge. Do a move to the lip, and top out directly above at the apex.
content.location: It is on the left side of the south face of the Moonboots Boulder.

content.description: Poppin' Tags starts sitting matched on the large edge. Using a pinch, gain the crack, and traverse right to a jug. Do an easy mantel, and top out.
content.location:
It is just a bit left from

Kitana

and

Moonboots

.

content.description: Sit start in the middle of the face on good opposing sidepulls. Climb up the right-angling seam through a mono pocket, and top out.
content.location:
This is just a bit southeast of

Aspen

.

content.description: Start in a small pit in the talus with hands on the horizontal. Thug your way out of the painful roof crack, and turn the lip.
content.location:
This is uphill behind

Aspen

on the south side of the block.

content.description: Bury yourself under the nose feature, and climb out using heel hooks and easy compression. Try not to dab turning the scrunchy lip.
content.location:
It is left of and below

Poppin' Tags

.

content.description: Start far right on a pinch and edge, traverse the crack all the way left, and top out at the highest point. This is a bit dabby/scrunchy getting past the boulder in the landing, but it is well worth the effort in fun climbing. It is sequence focused and avoids the lip of the boulder until topping out.
content.location: It is on the back side of Aspen, the largest of the first boulders on the Talus Field hillside.

content.description: SDS on a large flat edge and sidepull. Traverse up and right along the feature, gaining a jug flake on the slab to top out.
content.location:
It is in between the

Poppin' Tags

and Campus Boulders, uphill from

Kitana

.

content.description: Climb the clean friction face using nubbins and seams. There are great flat rocks for padding what would be a classic highball send (hence my rating). It has only been TR'ed by slinging the pointed top of the boulder. This is most likely in the V2 range.
content.protection: Pads and spotter or webbing/sling for TR.
content.location: It is about halfway up to the small summit in the talus on the biggest and most obvious block.

content.description: Kitana is aesthetic and unique. SDS with your right hand on the jug edge on the right arete and a left hand compression on the left arete. Climb the feature without using any of the surrounding rocks, utilizing both sides of the striking double arete. This is a great beginner problem.
content.location:
It is on the lower left end of the talus, downhill of

Poppin' Tags

.

content.description: Sit start, and climb the short finger crack on beautiful stone.
content.location: This ascends the right (east) face of Old Greg Boulder.

content.description: Begin on the low jug with your left hand and your right pinching the arete and small 2 finger pocket next to it. Campus to the small edge, then go to the lip, and work through a mantel.
content.location:
It is right of the Moonboots Boulder and left of

Aspen

.

content.description: SDS on incuts in the overhanging seam, power out to a good incut at the lip, and crank into a far left hand sidepull. Work over the lip onto the slab with thin and techy moves.
content.location:
It is just right of

Moonboots

on the same boulder.

content.description: Start with your left hand on a decent 4 pad edge low on the main rail and a small gaston crimp out right. Do a few hard moves to gain better holds higher on the rail, and turn the lip onto the flake on the face.
Sds on sidepulls/pinches under the low roof. Climb out and onto the big positive flake on the face to the top.
content.location:
It is easily identified from

Craftmatic

in The Saddle area when looking at the talus to the north. This is low and southeast on the talus hillside.
